ai.summary: Grottie Buckie Beach is a short, easy coastal hike in the UK, covering about 0.7 km along a scenic beach and adjacent coastal path. The route is beginner-friendly and suitable for families looking for a quick, relaxing outdoor outing with ocean views.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily flat coastal terrain with sandy beach sections and occasional rocky outcrops along the shoreline. Some sections may be soft sand near the water.
ai.safety_notes:
- Check tide times and forecast before visiting; beach access may be limited at high tide.
- Stay on marked paths and away from unstable rocks.
- Watch for slippery surfaces, especially on wet sand or rocks.
- Keep a safe distance from waves and never turn your back to the sea.
- Supervise children at all times.
- Take lightweight water and weather-appropriate clothing; the UK coast can be windy and cool.
recommended_gear: Comfortable, closed-toe walking shoes with good grip
Phone with offline map and emergency contact
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) for the most pleasant conditions; the hike can be done year-round with suitable clothing.

seo.title: Grottie Buckie Beach Hike – Easy 0.7 km Coastal Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Grottie Buckie Beach, an easy 0.7 km coastal hike in the UK. This short, family-friendly route offers beach scenery, flat terrain, and simple safety tips.
